I smoked from 14 to 35 years old, in the last years I smoked an average of 30 cigarettes a day (1 pack and a half).
I gave my life to Jesus, and I felt the need not to smoke or consume alcohol anymore, with the alcoholic drink it was overnight, I threw away what I had of beer and cachaça at home... !
I agreed with my wife to try to smoke the least amount of cigarettes I could in one day so with a lot of effort on my part I smoked 12 cigarettes, for one week she gave me 12 cigarettes every day for me to consume, the other week it was 11 cigarettes a day day, the other 10... and each week it decreased by 1 per day.
everything was going well, until it reached 4 cigarettes... I started stealing cigarettes from her, and ended up smoking 7, 8 cigarettes a day. until one day that during a prayer I was sincere to God, and said that I couldn't stop smoking and that I didn't really have the strength and that I really wanted to and asked God to help me and take the pleasure of smoking from me...
One day inside the church during a preaching that a pastor was doing, I heard a voice speaking in my ear clearly; - "So far I've let you try, to show that you're not capable. From today you don't smoke because I don't want to!
I was so scared that when my wife told me what I had heard, she saw in me a frightened and admired person, who started to cry because she saw that I was not delirious.
Upon leaving the church my car had been broken into and my documents and my wife's documents had been stolen, along with the vehicle's sound. But I knew that if I got over that nervousness and anger I felt at seeing my car like that I wouldn't smoke anymore (it was like a test to confirm my convictions in the voice I heard).
I called my wife and we went home , I took everything I had connected to tobacco ( tobacco , paper , lighter , matches , cigarette pack ....) I put it on a piece of paper and rolled it up we went to the street, and on a sidewalk I threw alcohol and I prayed to God; - Lord, trusting the voice I heard today I know that I will no longer feel like smoking, in Jesus name I set fire to all these elements linked to cigarettes!
And by the honor and glory of God I was freed, in the name of Jesus!

Uh, b I think you got your prices wrong. 16 bucks for 4 juul pods. 7-9 bucks for a pack of cigs. Juul pods cheaper in total. Also, your info on diacetyl is incorrect. Diacetyl, when inhaled constantly over very long periods of time, can cause popcorn lung, but the amount in vape juices, and I mean the maximum amount found in any vape juice, isn’t enough to cause it. According to whatever regulatory agency controls it (in the US), the safe working conditions for diacetyl are above the maximum amount of diacetyl found in vape juices. Cigarettes actually contain anywhere from 50 to 100 times more diacetyl than vape juices containing it. Cigarettes are worse than vapes, it cannot be disputed anymore. The evidence keeps piling up. However, vaping and juuling are not healthy in the least. They are a safer alternative to cigarettes, but quitting nicotine all together is better. I would like to note that children should especially avoid juuls. Adding nicotine (or any drug for that matter) into a developing body is a terrible idea. I did it with a ton of drugs, now I’m experiencing the harsh consequences only two years later, it’s not something that only happens over the course of decades!

There are so many things wrong with this video, including the small snippet about diacetyl. Diacetyl is used to give a smooth, buttery flavor and does not cause lung inflammation/damage in the quantities found inside vape liquid (9 micrograms). People often claim that it can cause "popcorn lung", or bronchiolitis obliterans. While technically true, the quantity of diacetyl needed to cause this is far higher than the amount you would find in vape liquid. The name "popcorn lung" comes from workers who contracted the disease while working inside popcorn factories, as they inhaled a powdered form of diacetyl. The concentration and quantity found in this powdered form are far higher than what you would ever expect to find in vape liquid. Not to mention cigarettes contain approximately 750 times more diacetyl than some of the "worst" vape liquid when it comes to diacetyl contents, and not one documented case of popcorn lung has ever been found in a cigarette smoker or a vaper.

This video is actually very misleading. Vaping has been around in some form or another for at least 30 years if you look at other countries. there are studies, long studies about the long term effects of vaping on your lungs and it's cancer risk. The distinction between vaping and juuling is just for flair, there is no discernible difference between the two aside from the pods used in juuls. Vaping lacks the 100+ dangerous chemicals that are present in cigarettes, there is a clear and quantifiable benefit for smokers to switch to vaping. For non-smokers, vaping is also low risk, not that i would encourage a non-smoker to vape. It does virtually no damage to your lungs/body and since nicotine is the only risky chemical in vape, the risk is equivalent to a cup of coffee. Low doses of nicotine, like those found in juul and other retail e-juice are not dangerous and can in fact have similar benefits to coffee. like heightened alertness

#SaveYourInternet
Article 13 is currently in the final steps of being passed in the European Union. Article 13 would make sites where users upload content (like YouTube, Reddit, Twitter, and Instagram) responsible for copyright infringement that the USERS of the site commit. This means that instead of the individuals (who use copyrighted content as their own) being punished, YouTube and the other sites are responsible for the infringement and can be sued by the copyright holders. Because of the sheer amount of content uploaded to YouTube every minute, YouTube can't manually search the videos for violations, and any mistakes their algorithm makes can cost them thousands in lawsuits. Therefore, the best option YouTube and other similar content sharing sites have is to create a "bubble" around the EU. NOTHING can get in, and only the largest companies like Warner Brothers can post content so YouTube knows that that content is safe. All this is made possible by the VAGUE wording in the current draft of Article 13, which allows lawyers of the copyright holders to sue YouTube on the basis of incorrectly interpreting vague laws.

You might be thinking: "Well, I'm in the US/Canada/India/Mexico so nothing bad can happen to me." It can. This sets the precedent for other countries and shows copyright holders in the US that if they can get a law passed, they'll make lots of money from lawsuits and have their content safe from copyright. They will pay senators and representatives big bucks in order to gain their vote in passing a law like this. We, as a collective internet, cannot let Article 13 pass.

So what can you do?
1: Spread the word. Copy/Paste this comment on every video in your feed. Tweet about it. Tell your friends.
2: If you are in the EU, talk to your representatives. Calmly and logically convince them that passing Article 13 in its current vague state is a terrible idea.
3: Share The Film Theorists most recent video about this issue.
https://youtu.be/GbXHrj8k7dg
4: Spread memes while you still can. Godspeed.

I smoked for 53 years. Started when I was 14. Back in the ‘50’s and early ‘60’s everyone smoked! Found a great vape shop and purchased a moderate vape device. Two weeks later I smoked my last cigarette. Been cigarette free for 3 months. Breath better, smell way better, taste better, generally feel much much better.

For anyone who is struggling with quitting cigarettes and has had disapointing experiences with mainstream pharma solutions, vaping is a great intermediate step. By the way I have decreased my nicotine level from six to three mg’s.

To me, vaping is a great way to stop smoking. I think alot of the negative press for vaping is because this solution does not involve big pharma or institutional medicene.

I find it very weird you guys didn’t talk about the studies which have found that the aerosols inhaled during vaping irritate the membranes lining the lungs, causing them to produce larger amounts of mucin which makes your lungs much more vulnerable to bacterial pneumonia as well as chronic bronchitis. In fact, the study found that the increased mucin in vaper’s lungs made it easier for harmful bacteria to attach to and absorb into the lining of your lungs, and into your bloodstream.

Just because vapes are slightly healthier than cigarettes does not mean they are without risk at all. While i used to vape, i had to stop because i was constantly coughing up quarter-sized blots of white-ish gray phlegm. My lungs were trying to clean themselves by making me cough out all of the extra mucus which had been produced. I don’t have asthma, and i never smoked before vaping. But maybe my story is a rare case, and maybe i just have weak lungs. I ended up going to the doctor and was diagnosed with bronchitis, this was after only a few months of vaping. He listened to my lungs and asked me if i have ever had asthma or pneumonia (which i hadn’t). I received an inhaler and anti-inflammatory’s (steroids), and within a week i was perfectly fine. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

You can still get hold of diacetyl liquids because for some reason, some members of the vape community actually love it. I’ll never know why but anyways... it’s not permitted for your average eliquid company to include this chemical so NO VAPING DOES NOT CAUSE POPCORN LUNG. But vaping is also less addictive than tobacco. Tobacco contains beta-carbolines, which act as monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOIs). Nicotine has been found to be far more addictive in the presence of MAOIs than on its own, to the point where it's basically impossible to get rats addicted to nicotine without coadministration of a MAOI. Thus, vaping is safer in terms of addiction too.

Furthermore, tobacco contains tobacco-specific-nitrosamines (TSNs), which are not present when vaping. While these have long been known to be some of the primary carcinogens of tobacco, we recently learned that they are ALSO psychoactive, and potentially much more potent at binding to nicotinic acetylcholine receptors than nicotine is, and so they may be contributing to the addictive potential of cigarettes as well.
